ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅii mbwó Mǒonsê ngie: Tsẅii mbwó penkʉ́ Áloŋ pie ée panuŋepwɔʼ ngie: Nùŋepwɔʼ těen ńdáʼa ńcʉa jʉʼʉ pfó nyìŋ tsìŋendá wɔb, ńdɔgɔ púʼu ńcʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ wɔ́.
en: The Lord said to Moses, “Speak to Aaron’s sons, the priests, and tell them: A priest is not to make himself ceremonially unclean for a dead person among his relatives,

ngiemboon: Tà ńdíndàʼ páʼ gie aa nyìŋ à pǔ ńtswéʼe na yé. Me gɔɔn nyìŋ páʼ má we, páʼ tá we, páʼ míŋ we wembàŋa, páʼ míŋ we wemanzwě, kà fɛ̌ we wembàŋa wɔ́ɔ.
en: except for his immediate family: his mother, father, son, daughter, or brother.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na fɛ̌ we wemanzwě gẅie à nyě te zsě mámbàŋa, á gẅie aa na ndá yɔb ńgwɔ́ we te zɔ́ʼ, à lɔɔn ńkíbe pfó yé, mbà à ge cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ.
en: He may make himself unclean for his unmarried virgin sister in his immediate family.

ngiemboon: Páʼ gie aa nkẅèmvfò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pé la, à těen ńgee ńcʉŋte mbùm ye, é cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ wɔ́. Mélàʼmie à lɔɔn ńgÿo púʼu, mbà à lɔgɔ sẅíʼi nzẅìŋ wé.
en: He is not to make himself unclean for those related to him by marriage   and so defile himself.

ngiemboon: Panuŋepwɔʼ těen ńdáʼa ńkwóon twó sɔ́b ńtÿɔ́gɔ pǎb wɔ́, pɔ́ těen ńdáʼa ńkwóon megʉ̀ŋe melÿò mɔ́b wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké těen ńdáʼa ńgwate mbùm yɔ́b wɔ́.
en: “Priests may not make bald spots on their heads, shave the edge of their beards, or make gashes on their bodies.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge gÿo gwɔ́ pʉ̀a ndʉalʉ̌a mbwó mèŋ, é piŋ ké le láʼ ńcʉŋte lezíŋ Ssé yɔ́b wɔ́. Mélàʼmie pɔ́ zɔ náa sɔ́ɔn shúm pwɔʼ sie mé tuɔ tà é pú shÿó, ńtí wɔ́ɔn Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔb, pɔ́ ge gwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: They are to be holy to their God and not profane the name of their God.   For they present the food offerings to the Lord, the food of their God, and they must be holy.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ těen ńdáʼa ńzɔ́ʼɔ káatÿǒ manzwě kà manzwě gẅie à pyě mekùʼ mé wɔ́ɔ, kà mbɔɔ gẅie andúm we jwoŋó yé wɔ́ɔ. Mélàʼmie anùŋepwɔʼ aa ndʉalʉ̌a á mvfò mèŋ Ssé ye.
en: They are not to marry a woman defiled by prostitution.  ,# 21:7 Gn 34:31 They are not to marry one divorced  # 21:7 Dt 22:19,29; 24:1,3; Mal 2:16; Mt 1:19; 5:31–32; 19:3–9 by her husband, for the priest is holy to his God.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ na pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ge gÿo gÿo mekùʼ panuŋepwɔʼ, mélàʼmie pɔ́ ée ndʉalʉ̌a; pɔ́ zɔ̌ piŋe ńnuŋe shúm pwɔʼ sie pi lɔgɔ ńtóo ńnáa mbwó mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gi; panuŋepwɔʼ ge gÿo gwɔ́ mbwó pi é gwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a. Mélàʼmie mèŋ, n gee Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a, mèŋ zɔ piŋe é sele gẅí, ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo pʉ̀a ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: You are to consider him holy since he presents the food of your God. He will be holy to you because I, the Lord who sets you apart, am holy.

ngiemboon: Múɔ manzwě gẅie aa míŋ nùŋepwɔʼ lɔɔn ńgÿo gÿɛ́, ńdɔg ḿbyé mekùʼ mé, mbà à sẅiʼí nzẅìŋ tá we: púʼu la, mé gẅiin lémaʼa yé mmɔ̌g pɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀.
en: If a priest’s daughter defiles herself by promiscuity,  ,# 21:9 Dt 22:21 she defiles her father; she must be burned to death.  # 21:9 Gn 38:24; Lv 20:14; Jdg 15:6; Rv 17:16

ngiemboon: Anùŋepwɔʼ gẅie à tyé twómvfò na mefɛ̌ pé, á gẅie mé la pfɛte mevɛ́ lɔg zɔ́ʼɔ nyìŋ á twó yé, ńcʉ́me yé mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a á lyɛ̌ʼ gie à la zyete fàʼ, ḿbiŋ ḿmaʼ menzsǒ fàʼ na yé, à těen ńdáʼa ńkwóon menoŋo twó mé kà éshʉate menzsǒ mé fʉ̀ʼ gie legwé kẅɛ̌ɛ na yé wɔ́.
en: “The priest who is highest among his brothers, who has had the anointing oil poured on his head and has been ordained   to wear the clothes, must not dishevel his hair  # 21:10 Or not uncover his head or tear his clothes.  # 21:10 Lv 10:6; Ezk 44:20; Mk 14:63

ngiemboon: À těen ńdáʼa ńgee lejʉ́ŋ tsɔ̌ mpfó wɔ́: ḿbiŋe ńké těen ńdáʼa sele ńcʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ, ńtí pfó tá we kà ye má we wɔ́ɔ wɔ́.
en: He must not go near any dead person or make himself unclean even for his father or mother.

ngiemboon: À těen ńdáʼa fó jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ ńkẅɛɛ wɔ́; ńké těen ńdáʼa ńcʉŋte jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ Ssé ye wɔ́. Mélàʼmie mé la tsɔ́ʼɔ yé, ńdɔg mevɛ́ Ssé ńzɔ́ʼɔ yé. Mèŋ n gee Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé.
en: He must not leave the sanctuary or he will desecrate the sanctuary of his God, for the consecration of the anointing oil of his God is on him;   I am the Lord.

ngiemboon: À ge zɔ́ʼɔ manzwě gẅie à nyě te zsě mámbàŋa.
en: “He is to marry a woman who is a virgin.

ngiemboon: À těen ńdáʼa sɔgɔ mpfɔ̌g wɔ́, é ké le zɔ́ʼɔ manzwě gẅie ndúm we jwoŋó yé wɔ́, mbɔɔ káatÿǒ manzwě kà manzwě gẅie à pyě mekùʼ mé wɔ́ wɔ́, à ge gÿo faʼ pɔ́ manzwě gẅie à nyě te zsě mámbàŋa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pé.
en: He is not to marry a widow,   a divorced woman,  # 21:14 Lv 21:7; 22:13; Nm 30:10; Ezk 44:22 or one defiled by prostitution. He is to marry a virgin from his own people,

ngiemboon: À těen ńdáʼa ńgee na ngẅɛ̀ pʉ̀a pie é te panuŋepwɔʼ wɔ́, ńzɔ́ʼɔ manzwě ńdɔgɔ ńcʉŋte ngẅɛ̀ ye wɔ́. Mèŋ zɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Mèŋ zɔ la tsɔ́ʼɔ nùŋepwɔʼ gẅie à tyé twómvfò na mefɛ̌ pé ńtÿɔ́gɔ na fàʼ yɔ́ɔn.
en: so that he does not corrupt his bloodline   among his people, for I am the Lord who sets him apart.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅii mbwó Mǒonsê ngie:
en: The Lord spoke to Moses:

ngiemboon: Tsẅii mbwó Áloŋ ngie: «Á gʉa na pʉ̀a pú mejwoŋó mejwoŋó pie mé ge gÿo tá zyé, mbɔɔ penkʉ́ penkʉ́ pú, epie é ge láʼ kẅɛɛ mǒ, é gwɔ́ menkǒon, é téen ńdáʼa faʼa fàʼ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ wɔ́.
en: “Tell Aaron: None of your descendants throughout your generations who has a physical defect   is to come near to present the food  # 21:17 Lv 3:11 of his God.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ mbàŋa gẅie aa nkǒon těen ńdáʼa ńcʉa jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ wɔ́: á nkǒon páʼ fʉ̀menÿɔ́g, páʼ kànyíʼikwò, páʼ nɔ̀ʼɔ mezẅé, páʼ nkèmekwò, páʼ nkèmepwó.
en: No man who has any defect is to come near: no man who is blind, lame, facially disfigured, or deformed;

ngiemboon: Kà kwò yé zɔ̌ la pwɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́ɔ kà pwó yé wɔ́ɔ.
en: no man who has a broken foot or hand,

ngiemboon: Kà nyìŋ gẅie á gẅiin tǔʼ wɔ́ɔ, kà pɔ́ métàŋa nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ, kà nyìŋ gẅie saŋ aa lejÿɔ́g yé wɔ́ɔ, kà nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin kùbte wɔ́ɔ, kà nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin lepagá wɔ́ɔ, kà nyìŋ gẅie membaŋ jʉʼʉ shʉ́ yé la tẅagte wɔ́ɔ.
en: or who is a hunchback or a dwarf,  ,# 21:20 Gn 41:3–4,6–7,23–24; Ex 16:14; Lv 13:30; 16:12; 1Kg 19:12; Is 29:5; 40:15,22 or who has an eye defect, a festering rash, scabs,  # 21:20 Lv 22:22 or a crushed testicle.  # 21:18–20 Lv 22:24; Dt 23:1

ngiemboon: Áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ tsìŋendá Áloŋ gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie aa nkǒon těen ńdáʼa ésẅɛʼte nnɛ́, ńnuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ tà é pú shÿó wɔ́. Á nue aa nkǒon. À těen ńdáʼa ésẅɛʼte nnɛ́ lénáa mmó léjÿó Ssé ye wɔ́.
en: No descendant of the priest Aaron who has a defect is to come near to present the food offerings to the Lord. He has a defect and is not to come near to present the food of his God.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ á pfɛ́ɛ mmó pwɔʼ Ssé ye, mbɔɔ shúm sie ée kwaʼ se Ssé.
en: He may eat the food of his God from what is especially holy as well as from what is holy.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, à těen ńdáʼa ńgee tá ńkúu jʉʼʉ lɔgnkʉ́ŋ gẅie mé lɔg ńkʉŋe jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ wɔ́; ńtí nue aa nkǒon, ḿbɔ́gɔ lécʉŋte mejʉʼʉ ndʉalʉ̌a mɔ́ɔn. Aa mèŋ cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gie e la lɔg mɛ̌ mejʉʼ ńdɔg ńgÿo mé.»
en: But because he has a defect, he must not go near the curtain   or approach the altar. He is not to desecrate my holy places, for I am the Lord who sets them apart.”  # 21:23 Ex 31:13; Lv 20:8; 21:8,15; 22:9,16,32; Ezk 20:12

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê gɔɔn yɔɔn nò mbwó Áloŋ pâ penkʉ́ pé tà mbɔɔ mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm.
en: Moses said this to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelites.
